title: EIA Rattles Oil Markets With Reports of Crude Oil, Product Builds
summary: Crude oil inventories in the United States increased by 1.8 million barrels during the week ending September 26, after shrinking by 600,000 barrels in the week prior, according to new data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) released on Wednesday. title: Canada’s LNG Era Has Officially Begun
summary: The highly anticipated LNG Canada terminal exported its first cargo of liquefied natural gas (LNG) on 30 June 2025 from its facility in Kitimat, British Columbia, marking the nation’s entry into the exclusive LNG export club. title: Global Investors Flock to Middle East Infrastructure Opportunities
summary: Global investment firm KKR has acquired a minority stake in ADNOC Gas Pipeline Assets LLC, the gas pipeline network of Abu Dhabi’s national oil company, in a move signaling growing investor confidence in infrastructure opportunities in the oil and gas-rich Middle East. title: Gulf Sovereign Wealth Funds Defy Oil Price Slump With $56 Billion Spending Spree
summary: The sovereign wealth funds of Gulf petrostates continue to be the top state investors globally despite weaker oil prices this year. title: Berkshire Hathaway in Talks to Buy Occidental’s Chemicals Business
summary: Berkshire Hathaway is negotiating the acquisition of the petrochemicals business of Occidental Petroleum in a deal that could fetch $10 billion for the oil major, the Wall Street Journal has reported, citing unnamed people familiar with the talks. title: Berkshire Hathaway nears $10bn deal for Occidental’s petrochemical unit
summary: Sale of division would further oil and gas group’s efforts to reduce its $24bn debt pile
